newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures close mixed, distants lower.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures close mixed, distants lower.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures closed mixed on Monday, as the yen's rises against the dollar offset Friday's higher CBOT corn market, traders said.
Prices ranged from 140 yen lower to 70 yen higher, with the benchmark May 1998 contract down 110 yen at 15,870 yen a tonne.
Distant months fell gradually from the opening, as the yen's rises triggered selling orders from local investors, traders said.
The spot May contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was being traded at $3.01-1/4 per bushel at 0725 GMT, against $3.00-1/4 at Friday's close.
The spot May of the CBOT soybean futures on the overnight trading system was at $8.45 at 0725 GMT, against $8.44 at Friday's close.
